title: 2nd Avenue Shooting
content: A Blair County man behind bars Thursday night after Police say he accidently discharged a gun and killed his friend. Thursday night the victim is being remembered. Family and friends still in shock over the chaos that led to the shooting death of Billy Callan Junior on the 1600 Block of 2nd Avenue. Coble used to live in the apartment above Callan, she says he was well-known and well-liked in the neighborhood. Thursday morning Police say video games and recreational marijuana took a violent turn when Police say his friend Michael Corle accidentally fired a stolen gun. Police say their investigation led them to Corle who told Police he buried the weapon near an Elementary School. Police recovered the gun. The commotion by the school noticed by parents. Some parents reached out asking why they were not notified. Police say the situation was under control posing no danger to the district. Corle is behind bars being charged with involuntary manslaughter. A vigil was held outside of Callan�s home Thursday night with people bringing candles and sharing their favorite memories of him.
